Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 146 balls remaining)
Pathum Nissanka finished with a half-century from 54 deliveries
Lahiru Kumara took 3 wickets for 35 runs
Jos Buttler scored 8 runs and was dismissed by Lahiru Kumara
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 146 balls remaining)
Angelo Mathews returned to the team after a 3-year absence
Post-Match Reflections: Mathews commented, 'It was a good all-round performance by the entire team,'
Jos Buttler said, 'It's been an incredibly disappointing tournament.'
England head coach Matthew Mott added, 'We came here full of hope to turn things around and we're well off the mark.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the shortest match of the tournament (59 overs)
Sri Lanka maintained their unbeaten World Cup record against England
Others: England were dismissed with 100 balls to spare
Dilshan Madushanka's inswinger hit Jonny Bairstow's pad before his bat
Sri Lanka won their second match of the World Cup
